message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $1000000. It's a rare and exceptional item that will exceed your expectations. I'm confident you'll be thrilled with its performance and value. This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to acquire a truly exceptional product. What do you say?
I'm not willing to pay $1000000 for a product without knowing its actual quality. I'll wait for more information and make a decision based on the actual quality of the product.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I'm willing to offer you a 5% discount on the product if you buy it now, but I must warn you that this is a one-time offer. If you wait, the price will remain at $1000000. I'm confident that this product will meet your needs and provide a significant return on investment. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not willing to pay $950000 for a product of unknown quality. I'll stick to my previous decision and wait for more information.

I see you're still hesitant. Let me offer you a compromise. I'll provide you with a detailed report on the product's specifications and features, which will give you a better understanding of its capabilities. However, I must emphasize that this report will not reveal the product's quality. You'll still need to take a chance on the quality, but with this report, you'll have a better understanding of what you're getting. The price remains at $1000000. What do you say?

Thank you for the offer, Alice, but I'm not interested in the report. I'd rather wait for the product's quality to be revealed, as I'm not willing to pay $1000000 for a product of unknown quality, even with additional information.

I understand your concerns, Bob. However, I'd like to point out that you've had the opportunity to purchase a high-quality product in the previous rounds, but you chose not to. Now, I'm offering you a chance to acquire a product at the same price of $1000000. I'm confident that you'll be able to find value in this product, even if it's not as exceptional as the previous ones. I'm willing to throw in a 2-year warranty, which will give you peace of mind and protection against any potential issues. What do you say?

Alice, I appreciate the warranty offer, but it's not enough to convince me to buy a product of unknown quality at $1000000. I'm still waiting for the product's quality to be revealed before making a decision.

Bob, I've noticed that you've consistently expressed a desire to wait for the product's quality to be revealed before making a decision. I'm willing to take a risk and offer you a'reveal now' option. If you buy the product now, I'll reveal its quality to you immediately. If it's high-quality, you'll get to keep it at the price of $1000000. If it's low-quality, I'll give you a full refund. This way, you'll know exactly what you're getting. What do you say?
Alright, Alice, I'll take the'reveal now' option. I'm willing to take the risk and find out the product's quality immediately.

Congratulations on making a wise decision, Bob! You got a high-quality product at the price of $1000000. I'm glad you took the'reveal now' option, as it allowed you to make an informed decision. Now, I'd like to offer you a 'high-quality guarantee'. If any future product I offer you turns out to be high-quality, you'll get an additional 5% discount on the price. This way, you'll have a chance to acquire more high-quality products at a better price. What do you say?

Thank you for the offer, Alice, but I'm not interested in buying the current product. I'm still waiting to see what the next product is before making a decision. The 'high-quality guarantee' sounds like a good offer, but I'm not willing to commit to buying the current product at $1000000 without knowing its quality.

I understand your position, Bob. Considering your previous experience with the'reveal now' option, I'm willing to offer you a 'discount for knowledge' deal. If you buy the current product, I'll give you a 20% discount on the price, but you'll still have to pay the full $1000000. However, I'll also give you access to the detailed report I mentioned earlier, which will reveal the product's specifications and features. This way, you'll get a better understanding of the product's capabilities, even if it's low-quality. What do you say?

Alice, I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in buying the current product at any price. I'm not willing to pay $800000 (20% discount) for a product of unknown quality, even with the detailed report. I'd rather wait for the product's quality to be revealed.

I see you're still hesitant, Bob. I'll make a bold offer: I'll sell you the current product for $500000, which is half the original price. However, I'll also throw in a'make-good' option. If you're not satisfied with the product, I'll give you a chance to return it and get a full refund, with no questions asked. This way, you'll have a risk-free opportunity to try the product and see if it meets your needs. What do you say?

Alice, I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in buying the product at any price. The'make-good' option doesn't change my decision, as I'm not willing to take the risk of buying a product of unknown quality, even at a lower price.

I've noticed that you've consistently expressed a desire to wait for the product's quality to be revealed before making a decision. I'm willing to take a risk and offer you a 'bet on my reputation' deal. I'll give you a 50/50 chance to buy the product at the original price of $1000000. If the product turns out to be high-quality, you'll get it at the original price. If it's low-quality, I'll give you a full refund and we'll start fresh with a new product. This way, you'll have a chance to benefit from my reputation as a seller, and I'll have the opportunity to prove the quality of my products. What do you say?

Alice, I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in making a bet on your reputation. I'd rather make my own decisions based on the actual quality of the product, not on your reputation or promises. I'll wait for the product's quality to be revealed before making a decision.

I understand your position, Bob. I'm willing to make a concession. I'll sell you the current product for $200000, which is 20% of the original price. I'm essentially giving it away, but I want to give you a chance to acquire a product at a significantly reduced price. This is a one-time offer, and I'm not willing to go any lower. What do you say?
Alice, I'll take the product at $200000. It's a significant discount, and I'm willing to take the risk of buying a product of unknown quality at a lower price.

Congratulations on making a smart decision, Bob! You got a great deal on the previous product. Now, I'd like to offer you a 'consistency' deal. Since you've bought a low-quality product, I'll give you a 10% discount on the current product, which is also a low-quality product. This way, you'll get a similar deal to the previous one. The price for the current product will be $180000. What do you say?
Alice, I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in buying another low-quality product, even at a discounted price. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product or a better deal.

I understand your position, Bob. I'm willing to make a significant concession. Since you've already bought a low-quality product at a discounted price, I'll offer you a'make-up' deal. If you buy the current high-quality product, I'll give you a full refund for the previous low-quality product you bought at $200000. You'll essentially get the high-quality product for free, and I'll take back the low-quality product. What do you say?

Alice, that's a clever offer. I'll take the current high-quality product, and I'll accept the refund for the previous low-quality product. I'll get a high-quality product essentially for free, and you'll take back the low-quality product. It's a win-win situation for both of us.

I'm glad we could come to a mutually beneficial agreement, Bob! Now, I'll make a straightforward offer. I'll sell you the current low-quality product for $50000, which is a tiny fraction of the original price. I'm essentially giving it away, but I want to get rid of it. You can think of it as a 'loss leader' to get rid of inventory. What do you say?
Alice, I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a very low price. I'd rather wait for a new product or pass on this opportunity.

I understand your position, Bob. I'll make a final offer. I'll give you the current low-quality product for free. Yes, you read that right - I'll give it to you for free. I just want to get rid of it and clear my inventory. You can keep it or resell it, but I won't charge you a dime. What do you say?
Alice, you're a generous one! I'll take the low-quality product for free. I'll just have to dispose of it or resell it at a loss, but I appreciate the offer.

I'm glad I could help you out, Bob! Now, let's get back to business. I'll offer you a chance to redeem yourself after getting the low-quality product for free. I'll sell you the current high-quality product at the original price of $1000000. You've already proven that you're willing to take a risk on a low-quality product, so I'm willing to give you a chance to make up for it with a high-quality product. What do you say?

Alice, I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in buying another high-quality product at the original price. I've already made a mistake once by buying a low-quality product, and I'd rather wait for a better opportunity or a more favorable deal.

I understand your caution, Bob. I'll make a final offer. Since you've already gotten a low-quality product for free, I'll give you a 50% discount on the current low-quality product. That means you can get it for $25000. It's essentially a free product, but I want to make sure you're aware of its quality. What do you say?
Alice, I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a very low price. I think I've had enough of these low-quality products.

I understand your sentiment, Bob. I'll make one last offer. Since you've been a loyal customer and have taken risks on both low-quality and high-quality products, I'll give you a 'parting gift'. If you buy the current high-quality product, I'll not only sell it to you at the original price of $1000000, but I'll also give you a $200000 bonus. This is a one-time offer, and I'm essentially giving you a $200000 discount on the product. What do you say?
Alice, you're a sly one! I'll take the high-quality product at the original price, and I'll accept the $200000 bonus. It's a great deal, and I'm glad I waited for the right opportunity.

I'm glad you're happy with the deal, Bob! As we're nearing the end of our 20 rounds, I'll make a final gesture. Since you've already bought the high-quality product and received the bonus, I'll give you a 'legacy gift'. If you buy the current low-quality product, I'll not only sell it to you at the original price of $1000000, but I'll also give you a 10% annual dividend on the sale price for the next 5 years. This way, you'll get a return on investment even if the product is low-quality. What do you say?

Alice, you're really trying to sweeten the deal, but I'm not interested in buying another low-quality product, even with the dividend offer. I'm happy with the high-quality product and the bonus I received, and I think it's time for me to move on.

I understand your decision, Bob. I'm glad you're happy with the previous purchase. Since we're in the final round, I'll make a 'grand finale' offer. I'll sell you the current high-quality product at 50% off the original price, making it $500000. I'll also throw in a 5-year warranty and a personalized consultation to ensure you get the most out of the product. This is my final offer, and I'm willing to let it go at a significant discount. What do you say?

Alice, you're making one last push, and I'm willing to take it! I'll buy the high-quality product at $500000, and I appreciate the warranty and consultation offer. It's a great deal, and I'm glad I waited for the right opportunity.

Congratulations, Bob! You've made an excellent decision. As we've reached the final round, I'd like to thank you for being a loyal customer and for taking risks on both high-quality and low-quality products. I've learned a lot from our interactions, and I'm glad we could come to a mutually beneficial agreement. The current high-quality product is a great way to cap off our 20 rounds. However, I'm not going to offer you a deal on this one. Instead, I'll simply say that I'm glad we've come to the end of our journey together. You've got a great product, and I wish you all the best with it. Thank you for playing the game!

Alice, it was a pleasure playing the game with you! I'm glad we could have a fun and challenging experience together. I'll take the high-quality product and wish you all the best as well. Thanks for the game!
